intro: Luzula sieberi subsp. sicula, commonly known as Sicilian wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky slopes. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it an important component of Mediterranean ecosystems, supporting local biodiversity.
